unnormalised: The Education Ministry has announced updates to the PM Poshan scheme. Under the revised guidelines, schools are now mandated to provide meals for a minimum of 200 days/yr. This initiative aims to improve nutritional levels amongst children.
normalised: The Education Ministry has announced updates to the P-M Poshan scheme. Under the revised guidelines, schools are now mandated to provide meals for a minimum of two hundred days per year. This initiative aims to improve nutritional levels amongst children.

unnormalised: The scheme now covers all govt. & govt-aided schools, benefitting approx. 11.8 crore students. It includes provisions for local food preferences and encourages the use of millets, aligning with the International Year of Millets 2023. This change hopes to give a boost to local farmers too.
normalised: The scheme now covers all government and government-aided schools, benefitting approximately eleven point eight crore students. It includes provisions for local food preferences and encourages the use of millets, aligning with the International Year of Millets two thousand twenty three. This change hopes to give a boost to local farmers too.

unnormalised: A dedicated helpline, 1800-11-2345, has been established for queries related to the scheme. Parents can also access info on the official website education.gov.in/pmposhan. The budget allocated for the FY 2024-25 is Rs. 12,000 crore.
normalised: A dedicated helpline, one eight hundred eleven two thousand three hundred forty five, has been established for queries related to the scheme. Parents can also access info on the official website education dot gov dot in slash p-m-poshan. The budget allocated for the F-Y two thousand twenty four to twenty five is rupees twelve thousand crore.

unnormalised: "We are committed to providing quality education and nutrition to every child," stated the Education Minister during the press conference held on 16/05/2024. The Ministry aims for 100% coverage by the end of the year, reaching even the most remote areas of the country.
normalised: "We are committed to providing quality education and nutrition to every child," stated the Education Minister during the press conference held on sixteenth May two thousand twenty four. The Ministry aims for one hundred percent coverage by the end of the year, reaching even the most remote areas of the country.
